page.title: NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Championship

rev.diff:
Line 100: Line 100:
====Cinderella team====
====Cinderella team====
â
Although there is no official definition of what constitutes a ''[[Cinderella (sports)|Cinderella]] team'', there does seem to be a consensus that such teams are seeded rather low in the tournament, and achieve at least one unexpected win in the tournament. The term became popularized as a result of [[City College of New York|CCNY]]'s run through the tournament in 1950.<ref>http://books.google.com/books?id=g42TyP-V5C8C&pg=PR41&lpg=PR41&dq=Pat+Forde+College+Basketball+Encyclopedia+Cinderella&source=bl&ots=cYNEeKNejy&sig=d42TdANaMvqbHSmDyPJj3dbr_qU&hl=en&ei=wfKXTd2mDoi3tgfstb3qCw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=5&ved=0CDAQ6AEwBA#v=onepage&q&f=false</ref> Since 1950, the term has seen use in other sports as well, though nowhere is it as prominent as in the NCAA tournament. In the [[1983 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament|1983 Tournament]], the [[1982â83 NC State Wolfpack men's basketball team|NC State Wolfpack]] led by Jim Valvano became the archetype of the "Cinderella team", the underdog that many fans look to as a possible spoiler over top-ranked teams.
+
Although there is no official definition of what constitutes a ''[[Cinderella (sports)|Cinderella]] team'', there does seem to be a consensus that such teams represent small schools, are seeded rather low in the tournament, and achieve at least one unexpected win in the tournament. The term became popularized as a result of [[City College of New York|CCNY]]'s run through the tournament in 1950.<ref>http://books.google.com/books?id=g42TyP-V5C8C&pg=PR41&lpg=PR41&dq=Pat+Forde+College+Basketball+Encyclopedia+Cinderella&source=bl&ots=cYNEeKNejy&sig=d42TdANaMvqbHSmDyPJj3dbr_qU&hl=en&ei=wfKXTd2mDoi3tgfstb3qCw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=5&ved=0CDAQ6AEwBA#v=onepage&q&f=false</ref> Since 1950, the term has seen use in other sports as well, though nowhere is it as prominent as in the NCAA tournament.
===Bracketology===
===Bracketology===
Line 260: Line 260:
==="Cinderella" teams===
==="Cinderella" teams===
â
[[NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Championship#Cinderella team|Cinderella teams]] are responsible for much of the excitement in the tournament,<ref>http://bleacherreport.com/articles/648001-the-slipper-fits-why-cindarella-stories-make-the-ncaa-tournament-so-great</ref> and sometimes the performance of Cinderellas prove to be more memorable than the actual tournament victories. The [[1983 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament|1983]] [[1982â83 NC State Wolfpack men's basketball team|NC State Wolfpack]] led by Jim Valvano became the archetype of the "Cinderella team", the underdog that many fans look to as a possible spoiler over top-ranked teams.
+
[[NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Championship#Cinderella team|Cinderella teams]] are responsible for much of the excitement in the tournament,<ref>http://bleacherreport.com/articles/648001-the-slipper-fits-why-cindarella-stories-make-the-ncaa-tournament-so-great</ref> and sometimes the performance of Cinderellas prove to be more memorable than the actual tournament victories.
â
